intro: Chamaesyce leucantha, commonly known as white sandleaf, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Chamaesyce leucantha thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
